meanings.definition: To remove a line or lines from a text or document.
meanings.sent1: She had to unline the incorrect information from the report.
meanings.sent2: Please unline the unnecessary sentences from the paragraph.
meanings.sent3: John tried to unline the mistake, but it was already printed.
meanings.sent4: The editor had to unline the errors to make the article perfect.
meanings.sent5: Unlining the errors made the document look much cleaner.

meanings.definition: Not in a straight line or alignment.
meanings.sent1: The unline path through the forest was more interesting.
meanings.sent2: Her unline handwriting made it difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: The unline rows of trees in the orchard looked artistic.
meanings.sent4: The unline arrangement of the books on the shelf was unique.
meanings.sent5: The unline pattern on the fabric gave it a modern look.

meanings.definition: To disagree or be in opposition to something.
meanings.sent1: I unline with your decision to cancel the event.
meanings.sent2: They unline on the best approach to solve the problem.
meanings.sent3: The siblings unline about which movie to watch.
meanings.sent4: The team unlined with the coach's strategy for the game.
meanings.sent5: She unlined with the new policy at work.
